parameters: Repeat the In-Stocking Endurance Event?
Yes
No
Yes
\n<Mirie>Oh? So you saw the scrap of paper I left at Guild's
entrance. I'm happy to know it worked to get your
attention.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>You promised a skill tome, right? Those
are real useful, so I don't mind putting
my small size to good use.
\n<Mirie>You sure have a big amount of motivation compared
to your size.
\n<Mirie>Well, that's fine. Let me explain the quest to you
then. It's too late to refuse, by the way.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Refuse? What do you-
Blackout
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Whoah!
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>You see, I need to get some data on how a body
inflicted with Mini can deal with other ailments.
\n<Mirie>Poison, paralysis, silence - all of those things
seem to still affect someone who has a Mini status
effect already on them.
\n<Mirie>So I was wondering you're much more susceptible
to status ailments while you're so small.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Uh, you don't have to experiment for
something like that. All you have to do is
ask me.
Mirie_Smug
\n<Mirie>Haha~! That's a funny joke, Alain! I can't be
a researcher if I just believe everything someone tells
me - I want to test this out on you.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Wait, so you want to inflict status
ailments on me? How are you planning to-
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Whoah!
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>I'll keep it simple. There's a place where I think
it'd be real easy to inflict status ailments on a
Mini'd adventurer.
Mirie_Annoyed
\n<Mirie>It's a little embarrassing, but this is all for
the sake of my research.
Mirie_Default
\n<Mirie>Let me just take off my sock here. I've been wearing
it all day, so it should be sufficient...
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Eh? Your sock? Are you a blasted psycho?
You've got to be kidding me, Mirie!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Hey! Listen to me! That's absolutely
disgusting! I don't want to go in there!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Blasted! She's not listening to me.
Mirie_Smug
\n<Mirie>Let me just take off my sock here. I've been wearing
it all day, so it should be sufficient...
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Whoah!
MirieS
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Hey! Hey! Hey! I'm not falling down
there!
(She seriously dropped me?!)
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Ngrk! I don't know how long I can hold
on! This fabric's sleeker than I expected.
(It looks like a bottomless pit. Just how
far of a drop is this?)
\n<Mirie>Oh wow. You actually caught onto my stocking before
you could fall in. You adventurers have super amazing
reflexes.
\n<Mirie>Still, that's not part of our deal, Alain. The
quest was to help me out with my experiment as a test
subject. Clinging to my sock like a piece of lint is
counterproductive.
\n<Mirie>You signed up to help me out with my experiments, so
stop resisting and just fall in already.
\n<Mirie>I need to see what ailments you'll get inflicted
with if you're in a place as simple as my sock.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>I'm pretty sure there are much more
reasonable places than your freshly worn
socks!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>It's no use! I can't hold on!
MirieSockBack
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Urk...! The fabric caught my fall... But
this stench is so strong.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Purple and white stars all around me -
this is definitely Mirie's sock. She
actually was crazy enough to do it.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>*cough* *cough* It's like I suddenly
entered a toxic swamp. The air's gotten so
heavy and thick.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Who'd have thought an alchemist's sock
was a completely different world?
\n<Mirie>Alright, Alain. I want to see how well you handle
such an oppresively disgusting environment at your size.
\n<Mirie>Let's see... I'll keep you in there for 10 minutes.
We'll see how many status ailments you have on you
after that, okay?
AlainFace
\n<Alain>*cough*Ten minutes? So I have to endure
for that long? I guess I've been through
worse, but this won't be pleasant.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>But 'Oppresively Disgusting'? If you know
that then at least wash your socks!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>It smells terrible in here! Don't you
have any dignity as a human being?
\n<Mirie>Terrible, huh? Well, I knew that. I don't need
any dignity if I can get some good data.
\n<Mirie>But if I had to be honest, this is one of my
cleaner pairs of stockings.
\n<Mirie>I've only worn this one pair today. Usually, I go
a few days without changing them out when I'm too
invested in researching.
\n<Mirie>But Alain, you're still able to talk to me right
now through the cloth, huh? I'll have to do something
to accelerate the process if you haven't been inflicted
with any ailments yet.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Accelerate the process? What do you-
BareFootBattler
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Huh? Wait, is that her foot?! Is she
actually putting it on?
\n<Mirie>If I reduce the amount of fresh air inside and also
increase the pressure, we should be able to see the
moment you get poisoned.
\n<Mirie>The dirt on my foot might blind you too, so that
should be something to look out for.
\n<Mirie>I wonder if being unable to hear you when you're
muffled will count as being silenced too.
\n<Mirie>Okay, do you best, Alain. In 10 minutes, we'll
talk and I can check what ailments you actually were
inflicted with.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>She's serious?! She does realize how
vulnerable I am at this size, doesn't she?
AlainFace
\n<Alain>I'm in her stocking so there's nowhere
to run! I'll have to endure until those 10
minutes are up!
AlainFace2
\n<Alain>Fine. I can deal with this. Let's go!
Endurance Battle!
Mirie's foot is incredibly strong. Survive for 10 turns
to complete the experiment!
MirieSockBack
Mirie_Shocked
\n<Mirie>Oh my. It's been ten minutes and you've endured
them all. As expected of an experienced adventurer.
\n<Mirie>Hold still, Alain. I'll get you out of my sock.
Mirie_Smug
\n<Mirie>Fufu... Well, it looks like you really did go
through plenty of status ailments while inside. Please
let me study your body while they're still present.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Urgh... At least give me a break before
that. Having to endure all that was a bit
too much...
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>So my sock was too much for you, huh? As expected
of the Mini status. A noncombatant like me can become
stronger than even a seasoned adventure thanks to it.
\n<Mirie>Well, that's fine. I'll give you a break. But
please compile your experience into a 5 page report
for me next time you come then.
\n<Mirie>For now, I'll get you the reward I promised. It's
a very useful skill tome in my opinion.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>I never want to do that again, but at
least I got the skill tome she promised.
Quest Completed
Mirie's experiment was successfully completed!
She is satisfied with the data she got from exploiting
Alain's Mini size.
Obtained Pure Cleanse Skill Tome!
Pure Cleanse is a skill that will allow its user to clear
any and all debuffs AND all status ailments!
Mirie's In-stocking Endurance Battle can be restarted
by touching her left foot!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Ngrk... It's so hot... The pressure's
too much... There's no air...
AlainFace
\n<Alain>I can't hold... on...
\n<Mirie>... Hm...?
\n<Mirie>I can't feel Alain anymore.
MirieInSock
\n<Mirie>Oh my. Would you look at that. He's not moving.
Did he pass out?
\n<Mirie>All I was doing was sitting here waiting too.
\n<Mirie>This is good data - It looks like even something
as simple as a dirty sock is poisonous when one is
affected by Mini.
\n<Mirie>He couldn't handle the collective pressure and status
effects caused by being in my sock, but I wonder which
precisely took him down.
\n<Mirie>Thank you for the data, Alain. I hope you mind if
I inspect your body while you're unconscious.
\n<Mirie>Considering that must have been a battle for you,
I'm just taking my spoils as the winner.
Taking part in the Alchemist Mirie's status ailment
testing, Dragon Rider Alain was defeated by the
researcher's dirty, worn stocking.
Before the ten minutes passed, the alchemist's foot
smothering him inside the starry stockings was too much
to endure. He could no longer breathe in the foul, hot
stench of feet and sweat.
Barely noticeable inside her worn stocking, the Mini
adventurer was Blinded by the darkness, Poisoned by
the stench, and Silenced by the pressure entrapping
him. The status ailments were too much for him.
No
Repeat the Paralysis Quest?
Yes
No
Yes
\n<Mirie>Oh? So you saw the scrap of paper I left at Guild's
entrance. I'm happy to know it worked to get your
attention.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>You promised a skill tome, right? Those
are real useful, so I don't mind putting
my small size to good use.
\n<Mirie>You sure have a big amount of motivation compared
to your size.
\n<Mirie>Well, that's fine. Let me explain the quest to you
then. It's too late to refuse, by the way.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Refuse? What do you-
Blackout
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Whoah!
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>Hehehe... You see - one of my clients gave me a
gift that I wanted to test out.
\n<Mirie>They were worried about a cute woman running a shop
all alone without any protection, so they gave me
this self-defense magic tool that seems to be pretty
popular in the capital.
\n<Mirie>It's supposed to paralyze intruders, and the
only way to deactivate it would be this magic charm
right here.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>A self-defense item? I'm not sure
what has to do with me.
Mirie_Smug
\n<Mirie>You don't get it? I want to see if a Mini adventurer
would qualify as an intruder or not.
\n<Mirie>Don't you think it's important to figure out what
the limitations of this security item are? Someone not
cursed would be able to grow back to normal size after
sneaking past the magical detection field.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Oh, I never thought about it that way!
That actually makes sense.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Fine. I'm okay with testing that magic
tool for you.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Oh, but just to make sure - DO you have
something to deal with the paralysis?
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>Yeah. This is some leftover paralysis clensing
cream that I made for another client. All I have to do
is spread over any skin for it to work.
\n<Mirie>Not as effective as what you adventurers use, but
it should work well for someone of your size.
Mirie_Default
\n<Mirie>Okay. Let me just figure out how to work this
magic tool. The ones from the capital are a little
bit too complicated for my tastes...
\n<Mirie>......... Okay... That should turn it on... Huh?
Mirie_Shocked
\n<Mirie>Wait. It's not supposed to do that. I haven't
registered my mana signature to it yet.
\n<Mirie>Gyah!
Mirie_Annoyed
\n<Mirie>Urgh... My body... No way...
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Whoah! Mirie! Are you okay?!
\n<Mirie>Of course I'm not... I just paralyzed myself
instead because I didn't register myself as the owner.
\n<Mirie>It looks like you're alright, though, Alain... I
guess the field doesn't consider you an intruder.
\n<Mirie>Seems I was right about these devices having a blind
spot to them. It must be grouping you on the same level
as insects...
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Looks like you're still strong enough
to talk your mouth off.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Is there anything I can do to help?
\n<Mirie>Yeah... Only I can turn off the device since I need
to give it my mana, but I need to be able to move first
before I can do that.
\n<Mirie>Can you put that paralysis cream on me?
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Sure thing.
\n<Mirie>You just need to apply it to my skin in a few
places and it should be fine.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>A few places? That's going to be a good
amount of work at my size...
[Mirie's Paralysis Care]
There are distinct locations on Mirie's body to spread
the paralysis cream.
Climb around Mirie's body and spread the cream on her skin.
Complete the quicktime events successfully. Make sure
it's on her skin!
No
Repeat the Eaten Gem Quest?
Yes
No
Yes
\n<Mirie>Oh? So you saw the scrap of paper I left at Guild's
entrance. I'm happy to know it worked to get your
attention.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>You promised a skill tome, right? Those
are real useful, so I don't mind putting
my small size to good use.
\n<Mirie>You sure have a big amount of motivation compared
to your size.
\n<Mirie>Well, that's fine. Let me explain the quest to you
then. It's too late to refuse, by the way.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Refuse? What do you-
Blackout
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Whoah!
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>Fufu... Alright. Let's start with me casting this
spell on your first...
Mirie_Shocked
\n<Mirie>Protect this soul beyond immeasure - Omega Guard!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>A protective skill? It's stronger than
typical skills too.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Whoah. I feel a lot stronger with this.
How much did it increase my defenses by?
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>Fufufu... Good. Looks like that was successful. I'm
glad this skill was something I could learn. And if it
applies to Mini'd adventurers too, that means the
experiment was a success.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Wait. So does that mean that the quest
is completed already then?
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Something tells me it isn't over yet.
And if you have to increase my resistances,
I feel this isn't going to be an easy quest.
Mirie_Default
\n<Mirie>You realized it, huh? Honestly, yes. Testing
that skill was the original experiment, but I ended up
screwing up and need a bit of help.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Screwing up?
Mirie_Annoyed
\n<Mirie>Some of the magic gems on the top cabinet may have
fallen into my lunch...
\n<Mirie>I was so preoccupied with my experiment that I
didn't realize what I ate until swallowed it.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Magic gems? Do you have Gale's eating
habits, Mirie?!
Mirie_Shocked
\n<Mirie>Oh, your dragon eats them? I guess that means
they should be safe for digestion then.
Mirie_Default
\n<Mirie>In any case. Those gems are pretty valuable. I
want you to write a warp seal on them so I can use
a warp spell to move them out.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>A warp spell? I'm surprised that you
know one. It takes a lot of mana to move
something even a little...
AlainFace
\n<Alain>... Wait! If you want me to write seals
on them, you want me to go in your stomach?
Mirie_Smug
\n<Mirie>You got it!
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>This will kill two goblins with one arrow. I can
test the resistance buff of the Omega Guard skill even
more AND get those gems out at the same time.
Mirie_Default
\n<Mirie>Of course, I'll write a seal on you too.
AlainFace2
\n<Alain>Even if you write a seal on me, I'm
still going to be eaten, aren't I?
AlainFace2
\n<Alain>Nope. No way. Blasted! I do NOT want
to get eaten just because you ate something
that you shouldn't have.
Mirie_Annoyed
\n<Mirie>You're so vocal about not wanting to do the quest.
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>But like I said earlier - it's too late for you
to refuse, Alain!
MirieV
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Waaaah! You've got to be kidding me?!
\n<Mirie>Don't worry. I've already tested the Omega Guard
skill. You should be able to survive in there.
\n<Mirie>I'm missing 4 small gems from my stock, so I must have
eaten them all by mistake. Make sure to mark all of
them with a warp seal.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>I'm going to be more focused on trying
not to dissolve in your stomach than on
finding those gems!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Blasted! What'll happen if your skill
wears off on me?
\n<Mirie>Well, if you don't want that to happen, how about
you focus on getting those gems so I can warp you out
then?
\n<Mirie>Don't worry. I can chug a few Revival Potions
if you end up dying.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>That doesn't make me feel any better!
And why do you look so happy about eating
me? Is this part of your research too?
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>I'll refrain from answering that question.
Mirie_Smug
\n<Mirie>Well then... Bottoms up!
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!
Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>Hm... Not bad. Does Mini cause the target to
taste better or something?
MCDMG
MCDMG
MC
MC
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Blasted... She seriously went and did it.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Finding four gems in her body, huh? If
she ate them during lunch, some of them
might have passed her stomach by now.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>This is going to be rough. I'll need
to make sure I find them all.
[Mirie's Internal Gem Quest]
Locate the 4 gems inside Mirie's body. Be careful not
to go too far and try not to die writing seals on
the gems!
No
AlainFace
\n<Alain>It's Mirie's Airship.

Don't Board It

\n<Mirie>Hello, Alain. Are you sure you should be getting
so close to me on my carpet?
\n<Mirie>You're lucky I know you're here, or else I'd
accidentally squish you like a bug.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>(As expected - the status effect researcher
is super excited when I'm around).
AlainFace
\n<Alain>(I appreciate her squatting down for
my sake, but this sure is an intimidating
stare down she's giving me.)
A
\n<Mirie>So you came to see me while your dragon's asleep? Did
you need something, Alain?
I'm here for a quest!
Look Up
I want to fight you!
Nothing

\n<Mirie>He couldn't handle the collective pressure and status

\n<Mirie>Thank you for the data, Alain. I hope you mind if

\n<Mirie>Considering that must have been a battle for you,
I'm just taking my spoils as the winner.
Taking part in the Alchemist Mirie's status ailment
testing, Dragon Rider Alain was defeated by the
researcher's dirty, worn stocking.
Before the ten minutes passed, the alchemist's foot
smothering him inside the starry stockings was too much
to endure. He could no longer breathe in the foul, hot
stench of feet and sweat.
Barely noticeable inside her worn stocking, the Mini
adventurer was Blinded by the darkness, Poisoned by
the stench, and Silenced by the pressure entrapping
him. The status ailments were too much for him.
\n<Mirie>Oh? So you saw the scrap of paper I left at Guild's
entrance. I'm happy to know it worked to get your
attention.

Mirie_Happy
\n<Mirie>Hehehe... You see - one of my clients gave me a

\n<Mirie>They were worried about a cute woman running a shop

\n<Mirie>It's supposed to paralyze intruders, and the
only way to deactivate it would be this magic charm

\n<Mirie>Don't you think it's important to figure out what

cursed would be able to grow back to normal size after
sneaking past the magical detection field.

\n<Mirie>Hehehe... Is Alain shouting at me from all the way

\n<Mirie>Did you think Mini was so simple that you couldn't

\n<Mirie>How small you get with Mini depends on your resistance
to ailments. To make sure you could fit inside the
airship I designed, I gave it a constant field of
resistance reducing magic around it.
\n<Mirie>Just by approaching it, you get even smaller than
